techmeme.title: Researchers find a flaw in carmaker Kia's web portal that let them track millions of cars, unlock doors, and start engines; Kia seems to have fixed the issue (Andy Greenberg/Wired)
Q&A with Meta CTO Andrew Bosworth on Orion, Reality Labs, building News Feed, competing with Apple, developers, the AR and VR bifurcation, Ray-Ban, and more (Ben Thompson/Stratechery)
Sources: Peak XV, the largest India-focused VC fund, has realized ~$1.2B in exits since its Sequoia separation in June 2023, selling stakes in ~12 companies (Manish Singh/TechCrunch)
Matt Mullenweg says Automattic has "been attempting to make a licensing deal" with WP Engine "for a very long time, and all they have done is string us along" (Matt Mullenweg)
LG rolls out full-screen screensaver ads to its smart TVs, including its expensive OLED models; the ads, on by default, can be disabled (Rasmus Larsen/FlatpanelsHD)
